summary:
Formula One (F1) is the top international racing competition for single-seater cars. It started in 1950 and is organized by the FIA. The name 'Formula' refers to the rules all cars must follow. Races are held worldwide on special tracks or closed roads, called Grands Prix. Drivers and teams earn points, aiming to win the annual World Championship.

F1 cars are super-fast, using aerodynamics to stick to the track. They rely on technology like electronics and advanced tires. Running a team is very expensive, costing around $265 million annually. Formula One is a big business, owned by Liberty Media.
title: Formula One
